text: Mountville is an unincorporated community in Troup County, in the U.S. state of Georgia. ==History== The community was so named on account of its lofty elevation. A post office called Mountville was established in 1835. The Georgia General Assembly incorporated Mountville as a town in 1897. The town's municipal charter was repealed in 1995. ==References== Category:Former municipalities in Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Unincorporated communities in Troup County, Georgia Category:Populated places disestablished in 1995
title: Mountville, Georgia
